name: sfpowerscript-installpackagedependencies-task
description: Installs package dependencies for an unlocked package as mentioned in the sfdx-project.json using sfpowerkit, This task is part of  sfowerscripts
helpMarkDown: Installs package dependencies for an unlocked package as mentioned in the sfdx-project.json using sfpowerkit to a target org, Refer to sfpowerkit:package:dependencies:install command of sfpowerkit, The devhub must be authenticated and the alias is a requirement for this command to work
author: dxatscale@accenture.com
instanceNameFormat: Install Package Dependencies to a target org

inputs.name: target_org
inputs.label: Alias or username of the target org
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path in the current working directory containing  config file for the scratch org

inputs.name: devhub_alias
inputs.label: Alias/Username of the devhub
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the alias of the devhub previously authenticated, default value is HubOrg if using the Authenticate Devhub task

inputs.name: keys
inputs.label: Installation Keys
inputs.helpMarkDown: installation key for key-protected packages (format is packagename:key e.g. core:key nCino:key vlocity:key)

inputs.name: apexcompileonlypackage
inputs.label: Compile Apex from only the package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Each package installation triggers a compilation of apex,uncheck to trigger entire org compilation on every package installation

inputs.name: forceinstall
inputs.label: Force Upgrade the package
inputs.helpMarkDown: Update all packages even if they are installed in the target org

inputs.name: working_directory
inputs.label: Project Directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory should contain a sfdx-project.json for this command to succeed

inputs.name: wait_time
inputs.label: Wait Time
inputs.helpMarkDown: wait time for command to finish in minutes
